    Sample Spaces

    The Sample Space

    Sample space objects can be used to encode the feasible space of binary two-stage designs for optimization.

    BinaryTwoStageDesigns.SampleSpace — Type.
    SampleSpace

    Defines restrictions on the sample space of a two-stage design to be used during optimization.

    source
    BinaryTwoStageDesigns.SampleSpace — Method.
    SampleSpace(
  n1range,
  nmax::TI;
  n2min::TI = 1, 
  maxnfact::TR = Inf, 
  nmincont::TI = 0, 
  maxvariables::TI = 500000, 
  GS::Bool = false
) where {TI<:Integer,TR<:Real}

    Creates a SampleSpace-object which defines the search space for finding optimal two-stage designs using optimaldesign. The primary use of dedicated sample sapce objects is the incoporation of specific operational constraints on optimal designs (e.g. maximal sample size).

    Parameters

    ParameterDescription
    n1rangepossible stage-one sample sizes, can be anything which is convertable to an integer vector
    nmaxmaximal overall sample size (stage one and two combined)
    [n2min]minimal stage-two sample size
    [maxnfact]maximal overall sample size must be smaller than maxnfact * n1
    [nmincont]minimal sample size upon rejection of the null hypothesis
    [maxvariables](approximate) maximal number of binary variables used when finding optimal design; if the sample space is too big this can be used to find approximate solutions to the optimization problem
    [GS]flag indicating wheather the design should be group-sequential (constant stage two sample size upon continuation)
    source
    BinaryTwoStageDesigns.interimsamplesizerange — Method.
    interimsamplesizerange(ss::SampleSpace)

    Return integer vector of valid $n_1$ values.

    source
    BinaryTwoStageDesigns.maxsamplesize — Method.
    maxsamplesize(ss::SampleSpace)

    Return maximal overal sample size as integer.

    source
    BinaryTwoStageDesigns.maxsamplesize — Method.
    maxsamplesize(
  ss::SampleSpace{TI,TR}, n1::TI2
) where {TI<:Integer,TR<:Real,TI2<:Integer}

    Return maximal sample size given n1 as integer.

    source
    BinaryTwoStageDesigns.isgroupsequential — Method.
    isgroupsequential(ss::SampleSpace)

    Indicate whether the sample space is restricted to group-sequential designs.

    source
